intro: Cupania minjalilen, commonly known as the red-veined cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red veins on its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and private collections.
